LanguageData.militaristic.label: Militaristic
LanguageData.militaristic.desc: A militaristic society, one who seeks glory in blood and death for their cause.
LanguageData.militaristic.positiveEffects.0: - +20% combat modifier when using your faction's military forces
LanguageData.militaristic.positiveEffects.1: - Once per five days, you can deploy a second squad from a single settlement by paying 20% of the squad's cost in Silver
LanguageData.militaristic.positiveEffects.2: - When creating a new settlement, it will start with a Barracks
LanguageData.militaristic.positiveEffects.3: - All military buildings cost 100 less upkeep
LanguageData.pacifist.label: Pacifist
LanguageData.pacifist.desc: A pacifist society that seeks to avoid conflict when and where possible.
LanguageData.pacifist.positiveEffects.0: - Once per five days, can send a diplomatic envoy to another faction to attempt to improve relations
LanguageData.pacifist.positiveEffects.1: - Deaths of members of your faction will not cause unrest to rise or happiness to reduce
LanguageData.pacifist.negativeEffects.0: - Cannot use military forces to raid or to capture other faction's settlements
LanguageData.authoritarian.label: Authoritarian
LanguageData.authoritarian.desc: A authoritarian society that seeks to hold control over its members by whatever means necessary.
LanguageData.authoritarian.positiveEffects.0: - Can send your military to raid another faction's settlement to enslave members of their faction instead of ordinary raiding
LanguageData.authoritarian.positiveEffects.1: - You can spend silver to increase the loyalty of a settlement
LanguageData.egalitarian.label: Egalitarian
LanguageData.egalitarian.desc: A egalatarian society is one that seeks equality amongst all.
LanguageData.egalitarian.positiveEffects.0: - Can reduce base tax by 20% for two tax periods to drastically boost happiness and prosperity
LanguageData.egalitarian.positiveEffects.1: - Receives a base tax bonus of (1% per 10% happiness)
LanguageData.isolationist.label: Isolationist
LanguageData.isolationist.desc: An isolationist society is one that seeks to stay reclusive amongst the world's politics and interactions.
LanguageData.isolationist.positiveEffects.0: - The time to upgrade settlements and construct buildings is reduced by 50%
LanguageData.isolationist.positiveEffects.1: - Every settlement receives an extra +3 to worker softcap per level of the settlement
LanguageData.isolationist.positiveEffects.2: - All settlements receive +10% to base tax
LanguageData.isolationist.negativeEffects.0: - The cost to create new settlements is increased by 100%
LanguageData.isolationist.negativeEffects.1: - Cannot use your military forces to capture other faction's settlements
LanguageData.expansionist.label: Expansionist
LanguageData.expansionist.desc: An expansionist society is one that seeks to spread their glory across the entirety of the realm.
LanguageData.expansionist.positiveEffects.1: - Once per year, starting after your first year, the cost to create a new settlement is reduced by 50%
LanguageData.expansionist.positiveEffects.2: - Settlements that you construct start at level 2
LanguageData.technocratic.label: Technocratic
LanguageData.technocratic.desc: A technocratic society is one that seeks the furthering of knowledge and continuous improvement.
LanguageData.technocratic.positiveEffects.0: - All research produced by your settlements is doubled
LanguageData.technocratic.positiveEffects.1: - Can send items that you have not completed the research for or are above your tech level to your settlements to be reverse-engineered, giving you their value in research points
LanguageData.feudal.label: Feudal
LanguageData.feudal.desc: A feudal society is one that supports a feudal contract, binding the society to a liege in return for protection.
LanguageData.feudal.positiveEffects.0: - Once per season, can request for an experienced mercenary from your faction to join your colony
LanguageData.feudal.positiveEffects.1: - All tithes received have their value increased by 20%
LanguageData.feudal.negativeEffects.0: - Failing to protect your settlements against a raid causes loyalty to drop significantly
LanguageData.empty.label: No trait
LanguageData.resilient.label: Resilient
LanguageData.resilient.positiveEffects.0: - Reduce prosperity loss by 50% when attacked
LanguageData.resilient.positiveEffects.1: - Cannot lose buildings or settlement levels upon a failed defense
LanguageData.raiders.label: Raiders
LanguageData.raiders.positiveEffects.0: - Increases the value of loot by 20% when raiding
LanguageData.raiders.positiveEffects.1: - Military forces are available 1 day sooner after using them to raid
LanguageData.defenseInDepth.label: Defense In Depth
LanguageData.defenseInDepth.positiveEffects.0: - Military forces receive a +2 level bonus to combat when defending
LanguageData.industrious.label: Industrious
LanguageData.industrious.positiveEffects.0: - 5% chance every time a settlement is billed to receive a significant boost in revenue
LanguageData.roadBuilders.label: Road Builders
LanguageData.roadBuilders.positiveEffects.0: - Authomatically unlocks the first road technology
LanguageData.roadBuilders.positiveEffects.1: - Roads are constructed in 33% of the require time
LanguageData.roadBuilders.positiveEffects.2: - Roads will also be constructed to connect to allied faction's settlements
LanguageData.mercantile.label: Mercantile
LanguageData.mercantile.positiveEffects.0: - A random trade caravan will arrive to your capital every 3-5 days
LanguageData.innovative.label: Innovative
LanguageData.innovative.positiveEffects.0: - Settlements passively generate research points equal to 5% of their total profit
LanguageData.lucky.label: Lucky
LanguageData.lucky.positiveEffects.0: - Negative random Empire events have a 20% chance to be re-rolled in exchange for a new event
